CatDescriptText: Mrs. Diane Horne, 930 Cresswell Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 23, 1957, pg. 10 with question: "Do you think Negroes in Pittsburgh use their economic power wisely?" answer reads: "No, and the reason why is that the Negro does not have as much money, as great an income, as the opposite race. If they did, they would be to establish more businesses, and I Mrs. Horne think they would."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Diane Horne, wearing coat with toggles, earrings, and striped scarf with brooch, standing in front of brick wall
